title: [K-12] Engineering Modeling and Simulation Inquiry-Based Learning Design

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic engineering principles and physics, along with fundamental computer literacy
context.additional_context: Conducted in smartphone-based limited technological environments, verifying learning effectiveness through project-based assessment

learning_goals: Learners select one appropriate modeling technique from three provided by the PhET simulation tool for a given engineering problem (e.g., bridge structure design), implement the simulation within 10 minutes, and submit problem-solving results as screenshots.
Analyze simulation results to predict system behavior and compare/contrast differences with real-world phenomena.

In teams of three, learners complete a bridge or circuit design project within five days, applying all five stages of the engineering design process (problem definition → idea generation → prototype creation → testing → improvement) and write a results report (3+ pages).

resources: Mobile-Friendly Simulation Tools (PhET, MATLAB Mobile, etc.)
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
